title: Family Christian Stores Makes Major Nationwide Announcement
text:
America’s Christian community will be losing one of its major retail outlets now that Family Christian Stores has announced it is closing all of its stores.
“The entire Christian communityÂ — indeed the entire nation — will be poorer as a result of this pending closure,” said Mark Taylor, chairman and CEO of Tyndale House Publishers.
Family Christian Stores had been battling slumping sales since its 2015 bankruptcy filing.
  Family Of ‘Jane Roe’ Reminds World How Their Mom Wants To Be Remembered Rapper Brings Grammy Crowd To Feet With Unique Performance Of ‘How Great Is Our God’ ‘The Case For Christ’ Hitting The Big Screen Soon “As with any worthwhile endeavor , there have been challenges and setbacks, as well as remarkable acts of service and self-sacrifice. The retail landscape is changing, however, and despite improvements in our product assortment and our store experience, we have not been able to generate the sales necessary to sustain our business,” Family Christian President and CEO Chuck Bengochea said in a letter to customers.
Family Christian Stores, largest Christian retailer, is closing after 85 years. Yes, all 240 stores. https://t.co/iVxwTACGNW pic.twitter.com/xzWaiofMPj 
— Religion NewsService (@RNS) February 23, 2017 

“We have fought hard because we deeply believe in our mission to help people find, grow, share and celebrate their faith in Jesus Christ,” he said.
 
However, he said, the closings became inevitable.

No timetable for the closings was announced.

“You cannot mitigate the impact of the largest Christian bookstore chain closing. I mean there’s just no way to avoid when you have 240 locations in 36 states going away,” he said.
“I’ve always said that the Christian bookstore is the supply sergeant in the Lord’s army because I started in the retail business myself so I understand the impact that can have on a community,” he added.
